metadata.title: CVE-2015-3885 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - negligible
metadata.description:
Integer overflow in the ljpeg_start function in dcraw 7.00 and earlierallows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (crash) via a craftedimage, which triggers a buffer overflow, related to the len variable.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-3885` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libraw-bin - 0.17.1-1
libraw15 - 0.17.1-1
No subscription required

libfreeimage3 - 3.15.4-6
No subscription required

darktable - 1.6.8-1
No subscription required

gimp-ufraw - 0.20-3
ufraw - 0.20-3
ufraw-batch - 0.20-3
No subscription required

rawtherapee - 4.2-4
rawtherapee-data - 4.2-4
No subscription required

edisplay - 0.9.1-6
exactimage - 0.9.1-6
libexactimage-perl - 0.9.1-6
php5-exactimage - 0.9.1-6
python-exactimage - 0.9.1-6
No subscription required

criterions.comment: libraw package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '0.17.1-1').
dcraw package in xenial is affected and needs fixing.
